name: Give Me An 'A' Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What E is a large land animal, the only living member of the mammal family Proboscidea?
questions.explanation:
Elephant.

	The elephant is the world's largest land animal and is native to Africa and India.

questions.text: What B is a city in North Central Italy, whose former name is Felsina?
questions.explanation:
Bologna.

	Bologna was colonised by the Romans in the second century BC, and lies at the foot of the Apennines.

questions.text: What L is any agent used to counteract constipation?
questions.explanation:
Laxative.

	There are many kinds of laxatives, including stimulant laxatives and saline purgatives.

questions.text: What M is a plant of the potato family, native to the Mediterranean region and used since ancient times as a medicine?  (It is mentioned in the story of Rachel and Leah in Genesis.)
questions.explanation:
Mandrake.

	Mandrake contains alkaloids and its large greenish-yellow or purple flowers produce a many-seeded berry.

questions.text: What C is a system of winds, or a storm, that rotates inwards, around a center of low atmospheric pressure?
questions.explanation:
Cyclone.

	The winds flow counterclockwise in the northern hemisphere and clockwise in the southern hemisphere.

questions.text: What H is the leadership or dominance of one state over others?
questions.explanation:
Hegemony.

	The term originated in ancient Greece, where the cities of Athens, Sparta and Thebes held hegemony over Greece in the fifth and fourth centuries BC.

questions.text: What T is a lake in the Andes on the Peru-Bolivia border?
questions.explanation:
Titicaca & Titacaca.

	At an altitude of 12,500 feet, Lake Titicaca is the highest navigable body of water in the world.

questions.text: What R is a class of vertebrates containing about 6,000 species worldwide?
questions.explanation:
Reptile & reptilia & reptiles.

	Reptiles are cold blooded and most lay yolky eggs on land.

questions.text: What W is a strand of metal, made by drawing a rod through progressively smaller holes in metal dies?
questions.explanation:
Wire.

	The drawing process toughens steel, so that a rope or cable made from steel wire is much stronger than an undrawn steel rod of the same diameter.

questions.text: What X is a gaseous nonmetallic element that is present in the Earth's atmosphere?
questions.explanation:
Xenon.

	Xenon was discovered in 1898 and is one of the Noble Gases.
